dcterms:title: Nasopharyngeal lymphatic plexus is a hub for cerebrospinal fluid drainage
dcterms:abstract: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space drains through lymphatics to cervical lymph nodes. This study identifies the nasopharyngeal lymphatic plexus as a major hub for CSF outflow and explores its aging-related regression. Utilization of pharmacological agents to enhance CSF clearance via lymphatic pathways holds potential therapeutic relevance for age-related neurological conditions.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Introduction
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: This section introduces the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) system and the role of nasopharyngeal lymphatic plexus in CSF drainage.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Methods
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Detailed methodology employed in the experimental analysis of CSF drainage through the nasopharyngeal lymphatics.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Results
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Results showcasing the role of the nasopharyngeal lymphatic plexus and the effect of aging on its function.

fabio:hasPart.dcterms:title: Discussion
fabio:hasPart.fabio:hasContent: Discussion on the findings and implications for future research and therapeutic strategies.

cito:cites.dcterms:title: Enhanced CSF clearance via the nasal lymphatic pathway
Regulation of lymphatic drainage in the central nervous system
